newsitem.title: USA: Key Technology sees Q1 loss.
newsitem.headline: Key Technology sees Q1 loss.

text.p: Key Technology Inc said it expects to report a first quarter loss in the range of $0.15 to $0.18 per share. The company said its first quarter sales rose to $13.4 million from $9.1 million in the year ago first quarter.
In last year's first quarter, the company reported net income of $328,000 or $0.07 per share.
The company cited a shift in the mix of product shipments to lower margin products, reduced gross margins in certain of those product lines and "a number of one-time events" for the loss.

Among those events, it says, was the relocation and startup costs for the new Specialized Conveying Systems (SCS) manufacturing facility, which exceeded estimated costs. It said that move also hurt margings for the SCS product group because of recruiting, training and overtime costs associated with staffing.
Key Technology makes process automation systems, integrating electro-optical inspection and sorting, specialized conveying and product preparation equipment.
The forecast loss for the first quarter, compares with a consensus First Call estimate for a $0.09 per share profit.
